page.title: 01REVIEW OF COCKFIELD AREA
page.content: This block covers parts of the parishes of Cockfield,Lawshall and Shimpling.It is primarily agricultural land in both private and local authority ownership, bisected by two A roads.Buildings include private houses,farm houses and buildings,council houses and a 12th century flint church.A primary school adjoins a modern village hall.There is a post office/general store,public house,restaurant and telephone exchange.There is a derelict railway station and evidence of a former branch line,a disused 2nd World War airfield, vestiges of Roman remains,a windmill and a stream which is a tributary of the River Brett. Cockfield Village Hall,which adjoins the school& is owned jointly by the village and the Suffolk C.C.,serves as a bi-weekly doctor's surgery,school hall and dining room and meeting place for village societies.
